[{"wordEn":"row","wordAn":"banjar","langSubgroup":"WMP","langName":"Malay","wordEnLong":"row, line, file (of ranges of hills; of men or things being in lines of ten, or of a thousand; of forming troups up in lines four or five deep)","setnote":"Based on the Malay, Toba Batak, Javanese and Fijian forms Dempwolff (1934-38) posited *banza(r) ‘row’, but the resemblance of Fijian basa to the other forms cited here seems best attributed to chance, and the remainder of the comparison is geographically very restricted and best attributed to borrowing from Malay.
